title: Riccardo Pick-Mangiagalli
text: Riccardo Pick-Mangiagalli (<a href="Strakonice">Strakonice</a>, July 10, 1882 – <a href="Milan">Milan</a>, July 8, 1949) was an Italian composer born in <a href="Bohemia">Bohemia</a>. He studied at the <a href="Milan%20Conservatory">Milan Conservatory</a>; in 1936 he succeeded <a href="Ildebrando%20Pizzetti">Ildebrando Pizzetti</a> as its head. He wrote several <a href="opera">opera</a>s and <a href="ballet">ballet</a>s, as well as <a href="chamber%20music">chamber music</a>; he also composed music for films.
